mapper.sql: id, create_date, update_date, data_status, desp, name, code, attachment_id_1, attachment_id_2,company_id
mapper.select:
select a.id, a.create_date, a.update_date, a.data_status, a.desp, a.name, a.code, a.attachment_id_1, a.attachment_id_2,a.company_id, b.attachment_link as attachment_id_1_link, c.attachment_link as attachment_id_2_link from t_car a left join t_attachment b on a.attachment_id_1 = b.id left join t_attachment c on a.attachment_id_2 = c.id where 1 = 1
and a.company_id = #{companyId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}

select a.id, a.create_date, a.update_date, a.data_status, a.desp, a.name, a.code, a.attachment_id_1, a.attachment_id_2,a.company_id, b.attachment_link as attachment_id_1_link, c.attachment_link as attachment_id_2_link
from t_car a left join t_attachment b on a.attachment_id_1 = b.id left join t_attachment c on a.attachment_id_2 = c.id where a.id = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.insert:
insert into t_car
id,
create_date,
update_date,
data_status,
desp,
name,
code,
attachment_id_1,
attachment_id_2,

mapper.update:
update t_car
create_date = #{createDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
update_date = #{updateDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
data_status = #{dataStatus,jdbcType=SMALLINT},
desp = #{desp,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
name = #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
code = #{code,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
attachment_id_1 = #{attachmentId1,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
attachment_id_2 = #{attachmentId2,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
where id = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}

update t_car set create_date = #{createDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, update_date = #{updateDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, data_status = #{dataStatus,jdbcType=SMALLINT}, desp = #{desp,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, name = #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, code = #{code,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, attachment_id_1 = #{attachmentId1,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, attachment_id_2 = #{attachmentId2,jdbcType=VARCHAR} where id = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
